doc.field: Lindseth Collection of Alice in Wonderland Ephemera
Lindseth Collection of Alice in Wonderland Ephemera

Contents include reproductions of: A photograph of Charles Lutwidge Dodgson as a young man, a picture-puzzle letter sent to a child-friend, around 1870, a Looking-Glass letter sent by Lewis Carroll to a child-friend in 1893, A photograph of Alice Liddell taken by Lewis Carroll, pages from the manuscript of Alice's Adventures Underground, the original version of Alice in Wonderland, copied out as a gift for Alice Liddell, preliminary sketches by Lewis Carroll for Alice's Adventure's Underground, the Alice Wheel, a picture wheel for you to make up illustrating versions and aspects of Alice and the Wonderland characters, a letter from Carroll to a friendly critic, 1892, concerning his tastes and attitudes, a proof rubbing from the block of one of Tenniel's illustrations with corrections by the artist, the Wonderland Postage-Stamp Case, a facsimile model of the postage-stamp case invented by Lewis Carroll in 1889, and more Lewis Carroll, an anthology of some of Lewis Carroll's less familiar verses and entertainments.
Lindseth Collection of Alice in Wonderland Ephemera
Series III: Games/Dolls/Toys/Puppets >> Subseries B: Games/Puzzles >> Lewis Carroll Jackdaw No. 137
